newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Petrogal says Saudi stake to cut crude volatility.
newsitem.headline: Petrogal says Saudi stake to cut crude volatility.

text.p: The eventual participation of Saudi Aramco in the capital of Petrogal could reduce volatility in the prices of crude delivered to the Portuguese state oil firm, Petrogal's president said.

"Our expectation is that 50 percent of our crude supplies will be from the strategic partner, which will provide a specific crude," Manuel Ferreira de Oliveira told a presentation about Petrogal on Wednesday.
"No two crudes are the same, and the advantage of having a strategic partner will be to stabilise about half of our crude needs," Ferreira de Oliveira said.
"The volatility (in prices) is associated with refining margins," he said.
"I think that we could have an agreement (with Saudi Aramco) in the area of supplies, which minimises but does not eliminate this risk (price volatility)," he added.
Petrogal has held talks with Saudi Aramco in recent months with a view to Saudi Aramco taking a possible stake in Petrogal.
